description:
Branch: master

Scenario:
1. Do a fresh installation of OpenStack with noVNC service.
2. Observe the 'noVNC' service start up logs.

Expected Behavior:
Service should be up and running.

Actual Result:
Service fails to start with the following error trace:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./utils/nova-novncproxy", line 135, in <module>
    flags.parse_args(sys.argv)
AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'parse_args'
title: noVNC service fails to start

comments.content:
Branch: master

Scenario:
1. Do a fresh installation of OpenStack with noVNC service.
2. Observe the 'noVNC' service start up logs.

Expected Behavior:
Service should be up and running.

Actual Result:
Service fails to start with the following error trace:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./utils/nova-novncproxy", line 135, in <module>
    flags.parse_args(sys.argv)
AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'parse_args'
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~unmesh-gurjar

comments.content: A recent change to nova/flags.py (commit ID: efede80046e0504dc8a68ab5447f97b05c02dd7a) has caused this issue.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~unmesh-gurjar

comments.content: My bad, I had a stale env. Marking the bug invalid.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~unmesh-gurjar

comments.content: I got this error too and doing fresh install from scratch. How do you fix this?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~winggundamth

comments.content:
Jirayut,
You can git rid of this error by copying the latest 'nova-novncproxy' from the 'bin' directory of Nova source into the 'noVNC/utils' directory of your installation.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~unmesh-gurjar

comments.content: Thank you so much. That solved it =)
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~winggundamth
